newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's Tung expects H-share rush - papers.
newsitem.headline: HK's Tung expects H-share rush - papers.

text.p: Hong Kong's future leader Tung Chee-hwa said he expected the territory to act as a fund-raising centre for mainland Chinese firms, Hong Kong newspapers said on Saturday.

Tung, a shipping tycoon chosen by a China-anointed caucus to run Hong Kong after the British pullout this year, said at a function on Friday night that potentially up to 4,000 Beijing-funded companies could list in Hong Kong, the papers said.
Hong Kong Stock Exchange chairman Edgar Cheng, who was at the same function, said there was no limit to the number of mainland firms that could list in Hong Kong as long as they met qualifications.
At present, 24 mainland firms are listed in Hong Kong. The territory, now a British colony, returns to Chinese sovereignty at midnight on June 30.
